inputs.note:
Patient: Dorothy Kwame
DOB: 04/18/1946 | MRN: MRN-2201

Subjective: 80F presents with right knee pain and swelling x1 week. Reports stiffness worse in the mornings. No trauma history.

PMH: Atrial fibrillation (on anticoagulation), Osteoarthritis, Depression (on SSRI), Hypertension
Allergies: None known

Objective:
  Vitals: BP 148/88, HR 78 (irregular), Temp 36.8°C
  Right knee: Mild effusion, crepitus, ROM limited by pain
  No erythema or warmth suggesting septic joint

Assessment: Osteoarthritis flare, right knee

Plan: Start Ibuprofen 600mg TID for 2 weeks for pain relief. Continue Coumadin and other home medications. Follow-up in 2 weeks, consider ortho referral.
inputs.meds:
Coumadin 5mg PO Daily
Ibuprofen 600mg PO TID (NEW)
Zoloft 100mg PO Daily
Lisinopril 10mg PO Daily
Omeprazole 20mg PO Daily
inputs.labs:
INR: 2.8 (therapeutic range 2.0-3.0)
Creatinine: 1.2 mg/dL
CBC: WNL
ESR: 32 mm/hr (H)
CRP: 12 mg/L (H)

flags.explanation: Interaction: Warfarin + Ibuprofen — Combined anticoagulant + NSAID therapy significantly increases the risk of gastrointestinal and intracranial bleeding.
Interaction: Warfarin + Sertraline — SSRIs inhibit platelet aggregation, potentially increasing bleeding risk when combined with anticoagulants.
The patient is prescribed Ibuprofen (NSAID) and Coumadin (anticoagulant). NSAIDs can increase the risk of bleeding in patients taking anticoagulants, potentially leading to serious complications.
